title: Ailing Butler delivers in 'winning time' for Warriors
content: Golden State's Jimmy Butler, playing through an injured tailbone, returned from a one-game absence to lead his team one win away from advancing to the Western Conference semifinals.

title: Cavs humble Heat, set records in lopsided sweep
content: The Cavaliers finished off the most lopsided series in NBA history with a 138-83 win over Miami in Game 4.

title: Source: WR Johnson to Browns after strange '24
content: The Browns reached agreement on a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Diontae Johnson on Monday.

title: Dept. of Ed.: Penn violated law with trans swimmer
content: The Trump administration said Monday that the University of Pennsylvania violated Title IX by letting a transgender swimmer compete on the school's women's team and into team facilities.

title: Lightning's Hagel leaves G4 loss after high hit
content: For concussions concerns, Tampa Bay Lightning forward Brandon Hagel left his club's 4-2 loss to the Florida Panthers on Monday in Game 4 of their first-round series, after a high hit from defenseman Aaron Ekblad that wasn't penalized in the second period.

title: NBA says Doncic was fouled late in Lakers' G4 loss
content: Referees missed the Lakers' Luka Doncic getting fouled with 33 seconds left in Game 4 of their playoff series against the Timberwolves, the NBA said Monday.

title: Sources: Shaq agrees to be Sac State's hoops GM
content: Shaquille O'Neal has agreed to become the men's basketball general manager of Sacramento State, sources told ESPN.

title: Altuve asks out of Astros' top spot, then homers
content: Houston star Jose Altuve asked Astros manager Joe Espada to move him out of the leadoff spot and into the second hole because he'd like more time to run to the dugout from left field, where he is playing for the first time in his MLB career.

title: Steph and Draymond's 'last ride' comes down to Playoff Jimmy
content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: How Arne Slot, Liverpool won the Premier League
content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Prem during a pandemic. This time they can finally celebrate.

title: White Sox unveil Bulls-inspired first-of-its-kind City Connect uniforms
content: The latest City Connect uniform is the first on-field look that combines brand elements from MLB and the NBA.

title: Barcelona win dramatic Copa del Rey clásico, Liverpool clinch Premier League, more
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid didn't disappoint in a drama-filled Copa del Rey final, Liverpool finally clinched the Premier League and Inter Milan are wobbling at the worst time: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Martinelli open to battle as Arsenal eye striker
content: Gabriel Martinelli has suggested Arsenal need to bolster their attack this summer and welcomes the competition for places any new arrivals would bring.

title: Luis Enrique blasts media ahead of Arsenal SF
content: Luis Enrique has hit back at what he believes is unfair negativity surrounding his Paris Saint-Germain side on the eve of their Champions League semifinal against Arsenal.

title: Source: Villa fear Rashford out for the season
content: Villa fear Rashford could miss the rest of the season with the hamstring injury which kept him out of the FA Cup semifinal, a source has told ESPN.

title: Germany's Völler on Rüdiger red: 'Can't do that'
content: Antonio Rüdiger needs to show "class" and respect for others, German national team sporting director Rudi Völler has said, after the defender appeared to throw ice toward the referee during Real Madrid's Copa del Rey loss to Barcelona.

title: Arteta urges Arsenal to 'live the moment' vs. PSG
content: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal are feeling the weight of history, but urged his players to "live the moment" as they attempt to reach the Champions League final.

title: Source: Saints mull Minnesota's Ramsay as coach
content: Southampton have made contact with Minnesota United boss Eric Ramsay as they continue their search for a new manager, a source has told ESPN.

title: 'Welcome to Wrexham' Season 4 trailer unveiled
content: The official trailer of the fourth season of hit FX series "Welcome to Wrexham" has been unveiled by Disney+ ahead of its release next month.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Chelsea going backwards in UWCL as quadruple hopes crushed by Barcelona
content: Chelsea appeared closer than ever to winning the Champions League, but after a crushing defeat to Barcelona, they now seem further away than ever.

title: Transfer rumors, news: D.C. United eyeing move for Pogba
content: D.C United are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for free agent midfielder Paul Pogba. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Vancouver, Miami still top; Portland hits form
content: After a sluggish start, the Portland Timbers are closing in on the elite teams in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: 'It's tariff, stupid': How Trump won Canada for Mark Carney
content: Mark Carney's Liberal Party secured a historic victory in Canada's federal election, defying expectations. Donald Trump's tariff threats and nationalist rhetoric galvanized Canadian voters, who rallied around the Liberals as a defense against American aggression. The election became a fight for national identity, overshadowing domestic concerns and reshaping Canada's political landscape.

title: Canada: Setback for pro-Khalistan leader Jagmeet Singh as NDP slumps to single digits
content: In the 2025 Canadian federal election, the New Democratic Party, led by Jagmeet Singh, experienced a significant setback, plummeting to single-digit seat count and losing official party status. Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberal Party secured a minority government amidst voter concerns over US-Canada relations. Following the results, Jagmeet Singh announced he would resign as party leader once an interim leader is appointed.

title: More layoffs! Infosys asks another batch of trainees to leave
content: Infosys has recently asked 195 more trainees to leave after they failed internal assessments, bringing the total number of affected trainees to over 800 since February. The company is offering support, including outplacement services and training programs.

title: 'We knew we had found something special': RR batting coach
content: Rajasthan Royals' batting coach Vikram Rathour lauded Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old sensation, after his record-breaking century in the IPL. Rathour believes Suryavanshi possesses exceptional talent and can serve Indian cricket for a long time with continued dedication. Gujarat Titans batter Sai Sudharsan also praised Suryavanshi's tremendous batting performance. Rathour expressed hope for RR's playoff chances, emphasizing the team's long-term vision.

title: China’s Xi Jinping sends message to tech cos as DeepSeek seen as US security threat
content: President Xi Jinping has declared AI a strategic priority, urging China to lead in this transformative field. China aims for self-reliance in AI, balancing innovation with safety. Despite progress, concerns arise over data privacy and potential military applications, particularly with AI models like DeepSeek. Amidst U.S.

title: 'Diwali jaldi aa gayi... ': Vaibhav Suryavanshi's father Sanjeev | Exclusive
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, became the youngest centurion in men's T20 cricket, leading Rajasthan Royals to victory. His father, Sanjeev, inspired by Shubman Gill's story, built a cement pitch for Vaibhav's training. Coaches VVS Laxman and Rahul Dravid have mentored him, with Vikram Rathour praising his exceptional talent and technique, contributing to his rapid growth in the IPL.

title: UP boy from minority community dragged by collar & forced to urinate on Pak flag
content: In Aligarh, Uttar Pradesh, a 15-year-old boy from a minority community was allegedly attacked by members of a right-wing group. The incident occurred as the boy was returning from school. He was reportedly forced to urinate on a Pakistan flag and chant nationalistic slogans.

title: Gold rate today: Gold dips Rs 4,000 from highs; opens at Rs 95,316 per 10 grams
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures at MCX experienced a correction after reaching record highs, influenced by a stronger dollar and shifting US economic policies. Retail activity remains strong in anticipation of Akshaya Tritiya, with consumers favoring lighter jewelry due to elevated prices.

title: Elon Musk replies to Vice President JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi: From training on a rooftop to creating IPL history
content: During the 2021 lockdown, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 10-year-old from Bihar, practiced cricket on his terrace. Four years later, at 14, he stunned the IPL by smashing the second-fastest century in just 35 balls. Vaibhav's journey highlights resilience, family sacrifices, and the power of dreams, proving that extraordinary talent can emerge from humble beginnings.

title: 'Kashmir will remain ours': Tourists visit Bhaderwah despite Pahalgam terror attack
content: Despite a recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam, tourists are still visiting Bhaderwah in Jammu and Kashmir. Visitors condemn the violence. They express their determination to keep exploring the region. Tourists refuse to be deterred by the attack. They feel safe due to the presence of the Indian Army. One tourist praised the army's swift response during the attack in Pahalgam.

title: Apple, Dell supplier warns of 'empty stores' in US on Trump tariffs
content: Pegatron, a major supplier to Apple and Tesla, cautions that Trump's tariff policies are creating confusion and potential shortages in the U.S. market. The fluctuating trade levies are disrupting global supply chains, forcing companies to rethink strategies. Prolonged tariffs could stifle innovation and increase consumer costs, impacting the tech sector.

title: How California's new license plate will look after first change in 45 years
content: California is set to revamp its vehicle license plates in 2026, ending a nearly half-century-old format. The current sequence, a number followed by three letters and three numbers, is running out of combinations due to increased vehicle registrations. The new format will feature three numbers, three letters, and a final number.

title: 'I pray such things don't happen': Actor Ajith condemns Pahalgam terror attack
content: Actor Ajith expressed profound sorrow over the Pahalgam terror attack, which killed 26 people, mostly tourists. He conveyed his heartfelt condolences to the victims' families and hoped for an end to such violence.

title: 'Dog whistle aimed at Muslim votes': BJP slams Cong over 'gayab' jibe at PM Modi
content: BJP has strongly condemned Congress's 'Gayab' jibe, accusing them of using divisive imagery and inciting violence against PM Modi following the Pahalgam terror attack. BJP leaders criticized Congress for allegedly appealing to its Muslim vote bank and echoing the language of Pakistan.

title: Cuttack father-son duo hid under discarded rags to escape Pahalgam attack
content: A family of four from Cuttack narrowly escaped a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam while celebrating a wedding anniversary in Baisaran Valley. Ranjit Kumar Bhola and his son Sandeep survived by hiding under rags amidst gunfire and screams, witnessing the deaths of several nearby victims.

title: 'India must show we stand together': Rahul urges PM Modi to call special session
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to convene a special session of Parliament. Gandhi emphasised the need for India to demonstrate unity and resolve against terrorism during this critical time. Mallikarjun Kharge, also requested a similar session, while earlier criticising the government's response to the attack, which claimed 26 lives.

title: Why is Germany's next chancellor, Friedrich Merz, so unpopular?
content: Friedrich Merz is poised to become Germany's next chancellor on May 6, pending approvals from his party and the SPD. Despite winning the election, Merz faces low popularity, with polls showing declining trust and doubts about his leadership. His recent policy U-turns, including debt brake reform and past alignment with the AfD, have alienated voters.

title: Gold proved your grandmother right! Double digit returns on Akshaya Tritiya in 25 yrs
content: Gold prices: Many financial advisors consider gold a dead investment that doesn’t generate any income or pay dividends. While that is true to some extent, gold is an excellent diversification tool because its price is not linked with other asset classes.

title: 'Scared of ED?' Congress leaders Udit Raj, Tharoor lock horns over Pahalgam remarks
content: A dispute has ignited between Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Udit Raj following Tharoor's remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, where he defended the government's intelligence capabilities, drawing parallels with Israel's situation. Udit Raj questioned Tharoor's loyalty to the Congress party, suggesting his stance might be influenced by fear of central agencies and criticizing his limited involvement in protests.

title: 'Sir, aaj maarunga’: Vaibhav Suryavanshi’s prophetic words lead to record-shattering IPL century
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy from Bihar, stunned the IPL with a record-breaking century. He smashed his way to 101 off 38 balls, including 11 sixes, becoming the youngest player to achieve this feat. His coach revealed Suryavanshi's confidence and determination, highlighting his dream of playing for India, guided by Rahul Dravid.

title: 'Rogue state fuelling global terrorism': India blasts Pak at UN over Pahalgam attack
content: India strongly criticized Pakistan at the UN, citing Defence Minister Khawaja Asif's admission of supporting and training terrorists. Yojna Patel condemned Pakistan's misuse of the UN platform for propaganda and highlighted India's experience as a victim of cross-border terrorism, particularly referencing the recent Pahalgam attack and expressing gratitude for international support.

title: IN NUMBERS: Vaibhav Suryavanshi’s historic night in Jaipur
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old sensation, etched his name in IPL history with a breathtaking century for Rajasthan Royals against Gujarat Titans. He reached the milestone in just 35 balls, breaking numerous age and batting records. His explosive innings included 11 sixes, leaving legends in awe and signaling the arrival of a prodigious talent.

title: Daughter of Punjab AAP MLA aide found dead at Ottawa beach
content: Vanshika Saini, a 21-year-old student from Derabassi, was found dead under mysterious circumstances on a beach near Ottawa, Canada, after going missing on April 22. The daughter of AAP MLA Kuljit Singh Randhawa's aide, Vanshika had recently completed her exams and was scheduled for an IELTS exam. Her family suspects foul play, and investigations are ongoing.

title: Pakistan fires along LoC for 5th consecutive day, Indian Army responds
content: For the fifth consecutive night, Pakistani troops violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir, prompting a measured and effective response from the Indian Army. The unprovoked firing, involving small arms, occurred near Kupwara, Baramulla, and the Akhnoor sector. These incidents follow heightened tensions after the recent terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex over 350 points up; Nifty50 above 24,450
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex went above 80,600, Nifty50 crossed 24,450.

title: 'Need collective will': Kharge urges PM Modi to call special Parliament session
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, Congress President, has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to convene a special parliamentary session. This request follows the terror attack in Pahalgam on April 22, 2025, targeting innocent citizens. Kharge emphasised the need for unity and a strong demonstration of collective resolve in the face of the brutal attack.

title: 14-year-old's fearless batting earns high praise from cricket legend
content: Rahul Dravid was ecstatic as Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, smashed a 35-ball century for Rajasthan Royals, a feat recommended by VVS Laxman. Sachin Tendulkar lauded Suryavanshi's fearless approach and bat speed. The young talent also became the youngest IPL player and broke the record for the fastest century by an Indian in the IPL.

title: Divorced Pak woman urges PM to allow her to stay or take daughter along
content: Iram Hasan, a Pakistani woman residing in Bareilly, faces deportation following the Pahalgam terror attack and stricter government directives. After her marriage to an Indian local ended in violence and triple talaq, she pleads to remain with her children.

title: UPSC CDS (I) result 2025 declared: Check list of qualified candidates
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the UPSC CDS (I) Result 2025, with 8,516 candidates clearing the written exam. Qualified candidates can check their status at upsc.gov.in and must prepare for the upcoming SSB interviews. Selected candidates are advised to submit their original documents as per the prescribed deadlines and complete necessary registrations.

title: Shoaib Ibrahim and Dipika Kakar gift their mothers designer diamond bracelets
content: Shoaib Ibrahim and Dipika Kakar returned from Kashmir to celebrate Shoaib's mother's birthday. They had decorated their living room and planned a family gathering. Shoaib revealed they bought designer diamond bracelets as special gifts for both mothers. The bracelet fit Shoaib's mother perfectly, overwhelming her with joy.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi sits behind Chris Gayle in fastest IPL century list
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, at just 14 years old, etched his name in cricket history by becoming the youngest centurion in men's T20s. He also blasted the second-fastest IPL century in just 35 balls while playing in his third IPL match for Rajasthan Royals in 2025.

title: E.Coli traces in water samples of Greater Noida condo where over 400 fell ill
content: Greater Noida's Ajnara Homes faced a health crisis as E.Coli bacteria contaminated water sources, leading to diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever among over 400 residents. Investigations revealed faecal contamination in water tanks, prompting health advisories to avoid tap water and boil drinking water. The builder was fined Rs 25 lakh and instructed to clean the tanks.

title: Over 200 flights delayed at Delhi airport, situation likely to persist till May 4
content: Flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport are facing disruptions due to the closure of the fourth runway for instrument landing system upgrades and a shift in wind direction. Over 200 flights experienced delays, averaging 30 minutes, and the situation is expected to persist until May 4.

title: Fitness coach reveals the right time to weigh yourself
content: Fitness coach Ashley DiGiacomo Schwartz advises against weighing yourself after workouts, big meals, during your period, before bed, or after high-sodium/carb meals due to water weight fluctuations. For accurate progress tracking, she recommends weighing yourself in the morning after using the bathroom and before eating or drinking anything.

title: Canada election results: Mark Carney’s Liberals inch closer to majority mark
content: Canadians went to the polls amidst a narrative dominated by Donald Trump's comments about Canada, overshadowing domestic issues. Early results indicate a tight race between the Liberal and Conservative parties, particularly in key regions like Ontario and Quebec. Poilievre's association with Trump proved a liability, while strategic voting patterns emerged in Atlantic Canada, reflecting the high stakes of the election.

title: DC vs KKR: Team prediction, head-to-head, pitch report, Delhi weather
content: Delhi Capitals, led by Axar Patel, are set to face Kolkata Knight Riders, captained by Ajinkya Rahane, at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. DC aims to improve their middle-overs batting, while KKR seeks to break their losing streak and revive playoff hopes. The pitch conditions in Delhi might be tricky, and dew could play a role later in the game.

title: Want a younger and sharper brain? This one phone hack can help
content: A recent study reveals that a two-week internet break can significantly boost mental well-being and cognitive function. Researchers found that participants experienced improved mood, attention spans, and reduced symptoms of depression, comparable to antidepressant effects. Disconnecting led to increased engagement in offline activities, fostering a positive cycle of healthier habits and a sense of feeling 10 years younger.

title: The rise of Apartners: Why are more couples in the US choosing to live separately?
content: A growing trend sees couples, dubbed "apartners," choosing separate homes despite commitment, challenging traditional cohabitation norms. Celebrities like Gwyneth Paltrow exemplify this, prioritizing independence and mental well-being. This arrangement allows individuals to maintain personal space, manage finances independently, and pursue individual growth. Ultimately, "apartnerships" highlight a shift towards prioritizing intentional intimacy and personal fulfillment within a relationship, proving love's adaptability.

title: India 5th largest military spender; expenditure 9 times more than Pakistan
content: Global military spending surged to a record $2.718 trillion in 2024, marking the steepest increase since the Cold War. India ranks as the fifth-largest military spender, allocating $86 billion, but faces challenges from China and Pakistan.

title: India briefs Taliban; Afghanistan govt condemns Pahalgam attack
content: India briefed the Taliban regime about Pakistan's involvement in the Pahalgam attack, seeking international support against cross-border terrorism. The Taliban's acting foreign minister condemned the attack and emphasized the need for accountability. This meeting highlights improving India-Taliban relations amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, primarily due to Pakistan's alleged support for terrorist activities.

title: Amid re-release of 'Andaz Apna Apna', Salman shares a nod to the movie
content: Salman Khan's recent shirtless photos, shared on Instagram, have ignited a frenzy among fans, showcasing his impressive physique. He playfully referenced 'Andaz Apna Apna' in his caption, coinciding with the film's re-release in theaters, which has been met with enthusiastic responses. Following his appearance in 'Sikandar,' fans eagerly await updates on Salman Khan's upcoming projects.

title: Ratan Tata: a life in innovation and enterprise
content: A series of essays and rare photographs of the astute businessman, pioneering philanthropist, nation builder and animal lover

title: Blinkit workers in Varanasi go on strike over fair pay and heat safety measures
content: The GIPSWU union claimed that Blinkit management blocked the IDs of around 150 workers, due to their strike

title: 50-year-old pourakarmika killed by a speeding truck while on her way to work in Bengaluru
content: The deceased, Saroja, working on a Direct Payment System (DPS) with the BBMP, was going to be made a permanent employee of the civic body on May 1, 2025.

title: Girl gang raped, three held in Ranchi
content: The incident took place a few days back under the Namkum police station area, but the father of the victim lodged an FIR on Sunday (April 27, 2025)

title: Indian student missing in Canada for three days found dead
content: Vanshika went missing on April 25, after leaving her residence to view a rental room, according to a social media post by an Indo-Canadian association linked by the High Commission.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Tourist's video of zipline ride captures moment of attack
content: The 53-second video, shot using a selfie stick, showed people running for their lives, with one of them falling, apparently after being gunned down by a terrorist.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 48 tourist sites in Kashmir shut amid security concerns
content: Gates have been closed at 48 of the 87 public parks and gardens in Kashmir in view of the threat perception to tourists

title: Odisha university punishes 100 students for indiscipline
content: While Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology in Burla has fined many between ₹1,000 and ₹5,000 for various acts of indiscipline, the harshest punishment includes reduction of one grade in theory subjects and conversion of pass grades to fail grades

title: Supreme Court declines bail to expelled Gujarat IPS officer Sanjiv Bhat
content: Senior Advocates Kapil Sibal, appearing for Sanjiv Bhatt, had contended that the cause of death was linked to pre-existing medical conditions, not police action.

title: ‘Neither country can afford a war; it is not just the last option but the last bad option’, says A.S. Dulat
content: Former RAW chief Amarjit Singh Dulat says it is important to keep the local Kashmiri happy and ‘on our side’

title: Maharashtra to establish ‘Tourism Security Force’ at popular destinations
content: The ‘Maharashtra Tourism Security Force’ will be started on a pilot basis during the Mahabaleshwar festival in Satara

title: Wanted Uttar Pradesh criminal carrying ₹1 lakh reward killed in police encounter
content: Murder suspect with ₹1 lakh reward killed in police encounter, weapons seized, multiple criminal cases registered against him

title: Rajasthan MLA urges PM to rescind order on deporting Pakistani refugees
content: Ravindra Singh Bhati, Independent MLA, seeks special rehabilitation for refugees living in India; he said many of them fled Pakistan because of religious persecution

title: BJP vs Trinamool In Bengal Temple Politics And A "Fake Hindu" Jibe
content: A newly built temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath in the coastal town of Digha in West Bengal has become the centre of a political flashpoint between Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's government and the BJP.

title: Canada Election Results LIVE: Mark Carney's Strong Message To Trump After Liberals' Victory
content: Canada Election Results 2025 LIVE Updates:Prime Minister Mark Carney-led Liberal party won Canada's election on Monday, according to local media projections.

title: Australian Woman Accused Of Murdering 3 By Serving Mushrooms Faces Trial
content: The trial of a woman accused of murdering three elderly people after serving them a lunch of poisonous mushrooms began in Australia on Tuesday, in a case that has gripped that nation.

title: Maharashtra Man Duped Of Rs 12 Lakh With False Promise Of Son's Admission
content: A case has been registered against three persons for allegedly cheating a businessman of Rs 12.2 lakh by forging documents and falsely promising his son's admission at junior college in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Skulls, Smoke, Spirits: Thailand's Ceremony For Unclaimed Dead
content: The Lang Pacha ceremony is observed by Thais of Chinese descent to give a dignified funeral to the unclaimed dead.

title: "Having A Lot Of Fun": Donald Trump On Completing 100 Days In Second Term
content: To mark the milestone in his second term, Donald Trump is visiting the site of one of his last campaign events, in Michigan, a battleground state that swung his way in the US election.

title: 10 Years Of Justin Trudeau: How Canada's Former Prime Minister Fell
content: Canada's Liberal Party has won the federal snap election held on Monday, handing Prime Minister Mark Carney a fresh mandate weeks after he replaced Justin Trudeau.

title: Mark Carney's Liberals Win Tight Canada Election Defined By Trump's Threats
content: Canadians voted on Monday (local time) to choose their next Prime Minister to confront America's trade war and annexation threats, which US President Donald Trump renewed in an election day message that drew immediate rebukes.

title: Independent Review On US Indictment Found No Irregularities: Adani Green
content: Adani Green said that its independent review of the US indictment of founder Gautam Adani and top Adani Green executives, who were accused of paying $265 million in bribes for power contracts, did not identify any non-compliance or irregularities.

title: "What Is Our Fault?" Pakistanis Question As Medical Visa Deadline Ends
content: The departure of Pakistani citizens from India through the Attari Border saw a significant rise on Tuesday, coinciding with the last day of validity for medical visas issued to Pakistani nationals in wake of the Pahalgam attack.

title: What Mark Carney And Liberals' Victory Means For India-Canada Relationship
content: Mark Carney and the Liberal Party's victory in the Canadian federal elections has set in motion a potential reset of one of the country's most strained international relationships: with India.

title: Delhi Police Arrests 3 For Identity Theft, Recovers 121 Aadhaar Cards
content: In a major breakthrough, the Central District Police busted a large-scale fake identity card racket and arrested three individuals involved in preparing forged documents and fraudulently updating Aadhaar details using impersonated biometric data.

title: Explained: What Caused Massive Power Outage In Portugal And Spain
content: An inexplicable power outage hit Spain and Portugal on Monday, knocking out traffic lights, causing congestion and disrupting airport operations and other means of transport.

title: "Disappointed": Pro-Khalistan Jagmeet Singh Loses Canada Polls, Resigns
content: New Democratic Party (NDP) chief Jagmeet Singh, known to be a pro-Khalistan leader, on Tuesday resigned after he failed to retain his seat in the Canadian elections.

title: Echidna Species Lived Watery Lifestyles Like Platypuses: Study
content: As the world's only surviving egg-laying mammals, Australasia's platypus and four echidna species are among the most extraordinary animals on Earth.

title: Adani Green's EBITDA Grew By 22%, Energy Sales By 28%
content: Adani Green Energy Ltd (AGEL), India's largest and fastest-growing pure-play renewable energy (RE) company, has announced financial results for the period ending 31 March 2025, showcasing significant growth and operational excellence.

title: Canada Elections 2025: Liberals' Projected Win Sparks Meme Fest
content: Canada Elections 2025: The users are poking fun at the Conservatives on X and celebrating the Liberals' win.

title: Punjab Man Arrested With 5 Pistols, Allegedly Linked With Pakistan
content: Punjab Police's Counter-Intelligence unit in Amritsar arrested a man and recovered five illegal pistols allegedly supplied through cross-border networks, officials said on Tuesday.

title: SHRC recommends compensation to Arappor Iyakkam convenor in case of police excess
content: The case involved the unlawful detention of 11 volunteers of the non-governmental organisation by the Taramani police in July 2019

title: Vaccine fails to save Peruvallur girl mauled by stray dog a month ago
content: The girl, Ziya Faris from Peruvallur near Calicut University in the district, was mauled by the dog on March 29 when she stepped out of her house to get some sweets

title: Madras University journalism department examination row: High Court-ordered inquiry vindicates student
content: Senior Counsel A.K. Sriram files his inquiry report stating that an exam was indeed conducted on May 11, 2024, as claimed by the student and that a question paper produced by her in court is also genuine

title: 60 hi-tech community toilets for women to come up in Bidar district in Karnataka
content: They feature a waste conversion system for fertiliser production and an inverter system for safe and convenient use even at night

title: Pahalgam attack: “Representatives of people should show their unity,” says Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge urges PM Modi to convene special Parliament session to discuss Pahalgam terror attack

title: Kalaburagi corporation fails to pay salaries to employees for February and March
content: Salaries of outsourced employees have not been paid for three months as the civic body is facing a financial crisis

title: Major blaze at electronics goods showroom building in Mumbai; NDRF called in for firefighting ops
content: While no injuries have been reported at the site in Bandra, the building adjacent to the affected structure was vacated as a precautionary measure

title: Solidarity in wake of Pahalgam attack testimony to international community’s zero tolerance for terrorism: India
content: Last week, the 15-nation UN Security Council issued a Press Statement condemning “in the strongest terms” the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Role in a risk society: how women bear a disproportionate burden
content: Coined by Ulrich Beck in his book ‘Risk Society: Towards a New Modernity’, the term ‘risk society’ describes a shift from an industrial society to one increasingly shaped by uncertainty and hazards created by technological and environmental developments

title: Pahalgam attack LIVE: Pakistan violates ceasefire for fifth night
content: Congress’s Mallikarjun Kharge, Rahul Gandhi ask PM for special Parliament session to discuss Pahalgam attack

title: Kerala CM terms Shaji N. Karun an icon of world cinema
content: In a condolence message, Mr. Vijayan said Mr. Karun’s works brought national and international repute to Malayalam cinema.

title: A.P. issues comprehensive guidelines for urban local bodies on fund utilisation
content: Municipalities have been directed to allocate a minimum 20% to 30% of their revenues to capital expenditure projects; not less than 30% of income, excluding government grants, must be earmarked for public health advancements

title: All snakebite deaths in Karnataka will now be audited at district level
content: Snakebite envenoming is a neglected tropical disease (NTD) caused by the bite of a venomous snake, which are usually accidental in nature.

title: NDA govt. using SIT as political tool in liquor case, allege YSRCP leader
content: The case originated merely from letters sent by an unknown individual, “Venkateswara Srinivas,” with no proven connection to the liquor trade.

title: He taught us to go the extra distance in capturing a frame: Sunny Joseph on Shaji N.Karun
content: Veteran cinematographers like him instilled the courage in the people who followed them to take a few risks and go the extra distance in capturing a frame.

title: Female Tribal Students to participate in long march for not receiving accommodation in govt hostels
content: Student Federation of India (SFI) held several discussions with the tribal department for the accommodation of these girls in government hostels.

title: 48 Resorts, Tourist Sites In J&K Shut Days After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government has shut dozens of resorts and more than half of the tourist destinations, days after a terror attack at the scenic meadows of Pahalgam left 26 civilians dead.

title: Canada Election Results LIVE: Mark Carney's Liberals Win Polls Defined By Trump Threats
content: Canada Election Results LIVE Updates: Canadians have voted to decide whether to extend the Prime Minister Mark Carney-led Liberal Party's decade in power or hand over the country's control to Pierre Poilievre's Conservative Party.

title: Maharashtra Congress alleges irregularities in MHT-CET State exams, writes to CM to seek a probe
content: Maharashtra Congress State president Harshvardhan Sapkal wrote a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis demanding investigation in the alleged irregularities in the State-level common entrance examination.

title: 1,815 students admitted to colleges last year, including three from MBBS course, wrote CET again this year
content: Karnataka Examinations Authority takes steps to monitor these candidates in the wake of the alleged engineering seat blocking scam last year

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Demolition drive paused in Kashmir but crackdown on supporters of terrorists intensified
content: The Centre has taken note of the regional parties’ concern over demolitions in Kashmir and was reviewing such measures, say sources in State government

title: Temperature soars, heatwave exposes Telangana’s fragile health and social systems
content: As the mercury shows no signs of mercy, the State is racing to shield its people from a growing, and increasingly deadly, threat

title: Five days on, Pakistan yet to communicate with India whereabouts of detained BSF jawan
content: The jawan, P.K. Sahu, a resident of West Bengal, had crossed four or five metres into Pakistan while accompanying farmers

title: U.P. govt. launches drive against encroachments on India-Nepal border
content: Multiple ‘illegal’ structures along radius of 0-15 km in districts along porous border were cleared between April 25 and 27; campaign prompts worries over implications on cross-border commerce

title: Kannur University’s internal mark entry system collapses
content: The failure, coming amid ongoing errors in the university’s examination system, has further deepened the academic crisis

title: Trained non-Brahmin archakas demand stipend of ₹15,000
content: They were trained in schools at temples under the purview of the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department

title: Mahayuti slams Congress leader’s reaction to statements of Pahalgam terror attack victims
content: Congress leader Vijay Wadettiwar had allegedly dismissed reports that terrorists asked for victims’ religion in Pahalgam before killing them

title: Mano Thangaraj re-inducted into Cabinet as Milk and Dairy Development Minister
content: This is part of the reshuffle that was necessitated after K. Ponmudy and V. Senthilbalaji resigned as Ministers on Sunday

title: T.N. government to reduce interest for late payment of property tax arrears in urban local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Urban Local Bodies Act has been tabled in the Assembly. It seeks to impose 0.5% interest on unpaid property tax, simplify procedures for issuing business licences

title: Speaking at the Assembly, Palaniswami raises concern over rise of grave crimes in Tamil Nadu
content: He says fresh investigation will be ordered into Anna University sexual assault case if AIADMK returns to power in 2026

title: Drunk men thrash policeman and tear uniform at Bhopal railway station; one held, two at large
content: A purported video of the incident has also surfaced on social media showing a group of men pushing, aggressively punching and abusing constable Nazar Daulat Khan

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Parliamentary panel on defence observes two-minute silence for victims
content: Panel was meeting to hold a review of resettlement policies, healthcare facilities, and other avenues for ex-servicemen; Rahul Gandhi attends the meeting

title: Modi to inaugurate first media-entertainment ‘WAVES’ summit in Mumbai
content: Bringing together officials from 33 countries and numerous industry leaders, the World Audio Visual Entertainment Summit (WAVES) will begin on May 1

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Long-term and diplomatic visas of Pakistani nationals valid, say officials
content: Officials clarified that of the 16 categories of visas issued to Pakistan nationals, two categories would remain valid after April 29 and that validity of the LTVs will not be impacted by the religious identity of the visa holders

title: T.N. government to regulate hoardings, digital banners, and placards in rural local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Panchayats Act, 1994, accordingly was tabled by Minister for Rural Development I. Periyasamy in the Assembly on Monday

title: ₹20,000 costs imposed on petitioners seeking re-evaluation of Group-I mains scripts
content: Counsel for TGPSC pointed out that the person whose case was referred by the petitioners had not contested his revaluation resultsand was not among the petitioners

title: In 2024, India's military expenditure was nearly 9 times that of Pakistan: Swedish think-tank SIPRI
content: The country’s military expenditure, the fifth largest globally, grew by 1.6% to $86.1 billion while Pakistan spent $10.2 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI)

title: Now, tourism as a weapon against terrorism
content: Sources said the Ministry of External Affairs is also joining the effort by appealing to countries that issued travel advisories telling their citizens not to visit Jammu and Kashmir after the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Two booked for thrashing man on train over watching video on Pahalgam attack
content: The Government Railway Police in Madhya Pradesh said they are working to identify the two accused through CCTV footage

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister invites farmers of the capital region for relaunch ceremony of Amaravati development works
content: Naidu holds discussions with the farmers regarding their grievances and aspirations at his Undavalli residence

title: Concessional rates for sending textbooks through ‘Gyan Post’
content: The service will have prices ranging from ₹20 to ₹100, for packages ranging from up to 300 grams to 5kg respectively

title: Rejected two-nation theory in 1947: Farooq Abdullah
content: The former CM says he always advocated for talks with Pakistan but one could not even think of talks with a nation that killed innocent people

title: Is there provision for emergency care on highways, SC asks Centre
content: The sharp comments from the Bench came while hearing a case over the delay in the implementation of the cashless scheme for treating road accident victims

title: Karnataka High Court directs State govt. to set up cyber investigation bureau or give life to cyber command centre with expert investigating officers
content: Court sets up SIT headed by DGP Pronab Mohaty to probe a case of alleged stealing of data from a private company supplying drones to defence sector

title: War is not an option; this is not a bad time to restore Statehood to J&K, says former RAW chief A.S. Dulat
content: ‘For the time being, everybody in Kashmir is one and all the Kashmiri leaders have said they are with Delhi...whatever the Government of India does, it should ensure to take the local Kashmiri along,’ Amarjit Singh Dulat, who has written extensively on J&K, said

title: A.P. CID police invite applications for home guard posts
content: Applications can be downloaded from https://cid.appolice.gov.in, and must be submitted between May 1 to 15, 2025.

title: 32 teams, 32 questions, 32 answers: Taking stock of what's ahead this offseason
content: the 2025 NFL draft wrapped up in green Bay, Wisconsin . there are 257 new faces joining the league, but will they help solve teams' woes? what questions linger after the three-day player selection extravaganza .

title: F-18 fighter jet rolls off US aircraft carrier and sinks into Red Sea
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: Eastern Conference takeaways: Cavs discover curveball in historic rout of Heat
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers swept the No. 8 seed Miami Heat on Monday, becoming the first team in the Eastern Conference to advance to the second round .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Warriors take 3-1 lead over Rockets
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on Sunday, the No. 3 seed Los Angeles Lakers fell to a 3-1 deficit after they lost Game 4 on the road to the no. 6 seed Minnesota Timberwolves . the lakers will have a chance to bounce back in Game 5 on Wednesday in Los Angeles.

title: Pistons' adjustments, Warriors' needs: What we learned in the first week of the playoffs
content: the first round of the 2025 playoffs is entering its second week . we've already seen some intriguing matchups, including a sweep of the no. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies by the No. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder . the four top-seeded teams are on the brink of punching their tickets to the second round .
